intro: Salvia adiantifolia, commonly known as silver sage or velvetleaf sage, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces striking violet to purple spikes of flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a drought-tolerant plant suitable for xeriscaping. Its aromatic leaves and showy flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
